metadata.title: kernel: OOB access in the Linux kernel's XFS subsystem (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s XFS file system in how a user restores an XFS image after failure (with a dirty log journal). This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system. 
            STATEMENT: This vulnerability is rated as having a Moderate impact. While theoretically it could lead to privilege escalation, the only known impact is a denial of service.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
redhat-virtualization-host-image-update is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
